subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] get your news in QS!
msgSnippet: I think few people would want the text smaller. In Adobe Reader; File | Print, in Page Scaling select Fit to Printable Area . If you click the printer button
messageBody:
I think few people would want the text smaller.

In Adobe Reader; File | Print, in Page Scaling
select "Fit to Printable Area".

If you click the printer button in the toolbar, you
get the same selections. What this actually seems to
do is shrink the entire page to fit the printer
margins, rather than reflowing the text.

--- Paul Tremblay <phthenry@...> wrote:
> I can create a document with no margins, but then I
> couldn't print it
> out myself! How exactly do you print your document?
>
> I can make my print larger, too, if everyone wanted
> me to.
>
> Paul
>
> PS Glad to see you got cut and paste to work


===========
Never insult anyone by accident.
- Robert A. Heinlein
